title: Joseph Françoise Michaud’s six-volume Histoire des croisades, published between 1812 and 1822, celebrated the royally directed crusades as expressions of French national greatness. A similar idea penetrated the popular imagination through public memorials to French royal crusading history, such as those found in the Salles des croisades at Versailles
